intro: Aeschynomene hirsuta, commonly known as hairy Aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural fields. It has a deep root system that helps in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility. Its adaptability and ecological significance make it an important species in certain ecosystems.
